About Business Unit
At Global Technology Services (GTS), we help our clients envision the future by offering end-to-end IT and technology support services, supported by an unmatched global delivery network. It's a unique blend of bold new ideas and client-first thinking. If you can restlessly reinvent yourself and solve problems in new ways, work on both technology and business projects, and ask, "What else is possible?" GTS is the place for you!

Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Location Statement
For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Graduate Professional Services - France (Paris)
summary: Work as part of a team of experienced AWS consultants on-site at our customers and together with our customers’ business and IT specialists to help them achieve…
date: Il y a plus de 30 jours
desc:
Recently completed or currently studying on a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM)
Proficiency in English (B2 or above)

For 13 years, Amazon Web Services has been the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. Millions of customers including the fastest-growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies trust AWS to power their infrastructure, become more agile, and lower costs. AWS offerings include artificial intelligence and machine learning services (AI/ML), scalable data stores for 100s of Petabytes, and flexible components to quickly build large, yet performant Enterprise-scale applications. AWS Professional Services work closely with AWS customers on all levels, for example, to help them re-define their business for a digital future and then guide them through their digital transformation, to extract insights from their data using the latest AI/ML and data analytics algorithms, to quickly build scalable applications thereby modernizing their enterprise IT systems, to integrate digital technology into their physical machinery (“Internet of Things”), and to secure their data and applications in the cloud. We collaborate across the entire AWS organization, mediating between our customers and other teams such as the AWS service teams to drive feature innovation based upon customer needs. The AWS Professional Services Graduate Program is a 12-month fast-track into our consulting teams. It is committed to developing early-career talent and future leaders at Amazon. The program consists of technical in-depth training, consulting training, and real-world projects with our enterprise customers, typically large multinationals, or our public sector customers.

As an AWS ProServe Graduate Consultant, you will:

Work as part of a team of experienced AWS consultants on-site at our customers and together with our customers’ business and IT specialists to help them achieve their desired business outcomes quickly
Receive continuous mentoring and training to support your personal and professional development both in your field of specialty (Data Science, Application Modernization, Data Analytics, Security & Compliance, Internet of Things, …) and beyond
Teach and coach customer teams and external partners in how to best use AWS Services and other technology, thereby helping them make good technology decisions
Innovate on behalf of our customers and contribute to team goals to exceed the quality standards of all deliverables

The Program will start in September 2020

Able to communicate effectively with people
Academic achievements in computer science, data science, or a related field
Knowledge of local business market, e.g. through internships, work experience, or student body activities
Intermediate-level local language skills (B1 or above)
Coding skills and/or entrepreneurial spirit as demonstrated in extracurricular activities
Self-starter with hands-on mentality as well as independent and accurate work competencies

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

EU Student Programs Team

title: Legal Support M/F (6 months)
summary:
Acting as a real business partner, the Legal Team helps Kayrros grow its business while mitigating its legal risk.
A Legal Support M/F (6 months)*.
date: Il y a plus de 30 jours
desc:
Passionate about tech? Interested in Energy? Come work for Kayrros, a fast-growing start-up using artificial intelligence to transform the world’s biggest industry.
Kayrros is headquartered in Paris, with offices in New York, Houston, London, and Singapore. By working for Kayrros, you will join an energetic team of 140 people, with diverse professional backgrounds—from data science and petroleum engineering to sales and marketing—and over 15 different nationalities and 10 spoken languages.
Our team of energy experts and tech wizards are working to bring transparency to the global energy market. We employ innovative technologies, like satellite imagery processing and artificial intelligence, to capture and analyse data across the energy sector. Combined with our expert analysis, we give our clients valuable information on global market movements to make better business decisions—whether that’s trading, investing or managing their operations.
In September 2018, Kayrros received €21M in Series B funding to continue breaking the boundaries of the energy market.
Interested in operating at the intersection of energy and the data revolution? Get in touch!
We are currently recruiting for our Paris office,
a Legal Support M/F (6 months)
You will join the Junior Legal Counsel as part of the Legal Team led by our Head of Legal. Acting as a real business partner, the Legal Team helps Kayrros grow its business while mitigating its legal risk.
As the company is growing, we need to have someone to assist the Legal Team in the following tasks:
Be the legal support of the Sales, Product and Tech teams by drafting and negotiating commercial contracts.
Take care of the GDPR compliance, administrate the corporate records, organize the employees’ representation etc.
Develop practical business solutions for our employees and facilitate legal awareness across the business by organizing legal training sessions.
Leverage legal to develop our revenue by drafting templates and structuring the legal department.
This list is not exhaustive.
Profile
This is an ideal opportunity if you are looking for a six-month contract starting in September 2020, and you want to join a fast-growing start-up.
You are currently completing a Master 2 degree focused in Business law
You already have an experience in a legal department or a law firm
You are curious, ready to multitask and interested in various legal (and other) topics.
Fluency in English and in French are mandatory
Why joining Kayrros?
We are a young, fast-growing tech company and are extremely passionate about what we do.
We are located in the WeWork building on Rue la Fayette, 75009 (free drinks, events and a vibrant atmosphere).
You will work with an international team and practice your English (or Chinese, German, Swedish, Portuguese...) on a day to day basis.
Recruitment process
Send your CV + a 5 lines intro (mandatory) specifying your availability.
A phone interview (HR)
A legal test
A physical interview (Junior Legal Counsel + HR)
The whole process will last one month at the maximum.

title: Chargé(e) de campagne emailing & CRM - CDI
summary: Des formations & conférences mensuelles sur des thématiques diverses : réseaux sociaux, développement personnel, intelligence artificielle….
date: Il y a plus de 30 jours
desc:
1er groupe bi-média de France en audience print-digital, Prisma Media est aussi l'acteur N°1 en presse magazine et en audience vidéo. Un leadership qui assure à Prisma Media un potentiel optimal d'audience de plus de 40 millions de personnes chaque mois sur ses différents médias.
Avec un portefeuille de 25 marques incontournables, le groupe est présent sur les principaux segments grand public (féminin, cuisine, télé, people, découverte, économie…).
Porté par la mission de devancer les besoins et envies de ses lecteurs et utilisateurs sur tous les supports, Prisma Media adopte une stratégie offensive de développement et d'innovation dans les secteurs en forte croissance tels que la monétisation de la data, la vidéo et le mobile, avec une ambition d'avoir toujours UN MÉDIA D'AVANCE.
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une équipe de passionnés, super-motivés et faire grossir l'activité dans une ambiance challengeante et bienveillante, alors bienvenue dans l’équipe CRM/DATA !

Votre mission principale portera sur la gestion et la planification de l’ensemble des campagnes newsletters des groupes Prisma Media (Voici, Femme Actuelle, Géo, Capital, etc..) et Cerise Media (OhMyMag, Gentside). Vous serez en charge du pilotage des campagnes emailings newsletters en étroite collaboration avec l’équipe CRM, l’IT data, la rédaction, le marketing et la publicité.

Vos missions ?

En collaboration avec les différents services, définition et recommandation de ciblages et de la planification des campagnes en fonction des objectifs business et produits.
Pilotage du routeur prestataire externe (Splio).
Participer à la construction et à la mise en œuvre du plan d’animation :
Participation à l’optimisation des parcours clients et à la conversion de nos inscrits NL en membres connectés
Réaliser la segmentation de chaque campagne pour en améliorer les performances en terme d’aboutissement, d’ouverture et de clic
Optimiser les créations avec les intégrateurs email et les objets en réalisant fréquemment des A/B tests
Analyser les performances des campagnes et mesurer les écarts avec les objectifs attendus
Optimiser les flux de travail entre les différents interlocuteurs (rédacteurs, commerciaux, intégrateurs, etc.) pour améliorer la productivité et la qualité des programmes de newsletters.
Suivre dans le temps les volumes et les performances de chaque base avec une attention particulière sur les taux d’activation, de désabonnement, d’attrition et de réactivation.
Garant de la délivrabilité des campagnes emails et du respect des normes RGPD.
Suivre en continu la délivrabilité de nos campagnes avec nos partenaires techniques (Return Path et routeurs).

Votre Profil ?

Ce poste est fait pour vous si :

Vous êtes titulaire d’un Bac + 4 à Bac + 5 idéalement orienté Marketing / Web / Data ou autodidacte et expert du canal email.
Vous avez une expérience confirmée d'au minimum 2 ans dans l'e-mailing au sein d'une agence d'email marketing/CRM ou au sein d'un marchand/éditeur ayant une base de plusieurs millions de profils.
Vous maîtrisez les fondamentaux de l'email marketing : délivrabilité, réputation d’IP, filtres spams, segmentation des bases emailings, optimisation des taux d'ouvertures & clics etc..
Les problématiques de délivrabilité email ne vous sont pas inconnues.
Vous avez déjà utilisé plusieurs outils de routage d’email : une expérience sur Splio est un plus.
Vous marquez un fort intérêt pour le web.
Les outils bureautiques classiques et analytics n'ont aucun secret pour vous (Suite Google,Word, Excel, Outlook, Google Analytics notamment) et êtes à l’aise avec la gestion des chiffres.
Vous êtes dynamique, rigoureux(se), organisé(e) et faites preuve d’une forte capacité d’analyse.

Votre future entreprise ?

Vous vous demandez qui se cache derrière GEO, Télé Loisirs, Femme Actuelle, Capital Gala, Voici et une quinzaine d’autres titres ?
C’est Prisma Media, leader historique de la presse magazine, désormais une entreprise full media print, digital, vidéo forte de :

1,5 millions d’abonnés à nos magazines
80 millions de magazines vendu par an
Plus de 30 Millions de visiteurs uniques par mois sur nos sites Web
Son appartenance au Groupe Bertelsmann Leader mondial dans le domaine des Media (M6, RTL, BMG, Freemantle…)

Les petits plus chez nous ?

6 semaines de congés payés, 3 semaines de RTT, 13ème mois, Participation
4 abonnements magazines print au choix dans notre catalogue ainsi que tous les magazines en digital
Des locaux attrayants : ZenZone (fauteuil massant, hamac), jardin, terrasses, Ping-pong, babyfoot, Wifi à volonté…
Une conciergerie : pressing, coiffeur, boutique…
Café et thé gratuits, cantine de qualité avec des produits de saisons cuisinés sur place
90% de nos collaborateur sont heureux dans leur job (source : Enquête Bertelsmann 2019)
Des formations & conférences mensuelles sur des thématiques diverses : réseaux sociaux, développement personnel, intelligence artificielle…
Des events annuels : Garden party, journées Vis ma vie…
Un métro (ligne 13 - Gabriel Peri) à deux minutes à pied et des navettes pour ceux qui préfèrent le RER
Prisma Media propose tous ses postes aux personnes en situation de handicap en privilégiant une logique de compétence et d'emploi pérenne. Le groupe est signataire de la Charte de la Diversité et partenaire de l'association Adapt.
Exercice de vos droits
Conformément à la réglementation en vigueur, vous pouvez exercer vos droits d'accès, de rectification, d'opposition, de suppression, de limitation du traitement, et à la portabilité des données à caractère personnel, en adressant votre demande au DPO du Groupe Prisma Media, soit à dpo@prismamedia.com soit par courrier à Prisma Media - DPO, 13 Rue Henri Barbusse. 92230 Gennevilliers.

Pays: France
Etat/Région: Hauts-de-Seine
Ville: GENNEVILLIERS

title: Workshop & IT Engineer
summary:
Evidence of emotional intelligence is critical.
Mindray Europe, as part of the global Mindray business, offers a wide selection of bespoke benefits dependent on…
date: il y a 28 jours
desc:
Workshop Engineer specialized in IT – Paris Area
French Headquarter (Creteil) based with flexibility to travel all France time to time
Highly Competitive Salary + Excellent Benefits + Career Enhancement
Reporting to National Service Manager, France
Become part of one of the fastest growing med-tech companies globally.
Due to the rapid expansion of Mindray’s success, we have an opportunity for a highly experienced and well-versed Service expert to demonstrate creativity and innovation as a Workshop Engineer specialized in IT within our ultra-ambitious team as we continue to disrupt the market!
As an emotionally intelligent professional with a background of understanding and responding to internal and external customers’ needs in hour French Headquarter and on site, you will use this role to join our growing business in this position working alongside senior stakeholders in driving key service relationships whilst showcasing your appetite for overachievement.
In addition, you also will assist our PMLS IT Product Specialist to facilitate Mindray interface solutions by initiating and closely monitoring / supporting connectivity projects (Network, HL7, etc.). PMLS products, especially patient monitoring systems, are carrying more and more IT functionalities.
Experienced in service role within Patient Monitoring and Ultrasound equipment, you will have a background including providing Remote installation, onsite training and servicing or a Biomedical qualification.
This role will be shaped by the right candidate, and we are looking for you to be an absolute expert in PMLS in France, you will be a self-starter, with an unquestionable influencing and negotiation skills, energised by a varied and fast-paced role where you can drive the strategic direction of PMLS Service. In return you will work with industry-leading technology, backed up by stable double-digit growth, an awesome team, and a creative and disruptive working environment.
Your responsibilities:
Respond to customer calls during office hours, Monday to Friday bearing in mind that customers must be contacted within 24 hrs of their initial call.
Share responsibility for the effective management of the workshop activities including promoting new contracts and liaising with customers for renewals.
Perform Corrective repair and planned preventative maintenance (PPM) in workshop and to the levels outlined in the service manual according to Mindray SLA (Service Level Agreement)
Support our IT team on sales, installations and service teams on IT solutions: assist the IT team on customer needs definition, support the development and the deployment of the solutions, support IB questions, actively propose evolution and upgrade to customer by launching renewal campaigns
Assist sales and marketing team with tender opportunities as technical support and to promote service contracts.
Maintaining tools and test equipment properly and liaising with the Service Supervisor/Manager to ensure they are calibrated.
Maintenance of spare parts inventory and other company equipment and supplies.
Occasional training of clinical staff on designated equipment.
Responsible for tracking and maintaining both parts and loaner inventories allocated to them.
Other tasks or responsibilities designated by the Field Service Supervisor, France
What are we looking for in you?
Field service experience on Healthcare market in France is vital.
Based in the French headquarter (Creteil). Occasional travel in France will be required.
Flexible to travel as required
Extensive PMLS knowledge critical, Knowledge in Ultrasound is a plus
Experience of providing training on medical devices capital equipment
Good electronic, software and mechanical skill to perform corrective & preventive maintenance and to assist Field service engineers on site installation
Technically proficient in the troubleshooting, repair, and calibration of all medical products.
Network Knowledge (TCPIP / HL7 / Wi-Fi roaming / Routers and switch)
Knowledge in Virtualized solutions (VM environment / VPN access setup)
Ability to assist service team on IT related troubleshooting
Highly customer focused along with your hunger to achieve more, this role has significant development potential for the right candidate!
Evidence of emotional intelligence is critical
An ability to address customer requests through strong listening skills
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with an aptitude for building strong relationships
Proven negotiation skills with a problem-solving attitude
Organized, Quality oriented & focussed with good rigor to perform daily activities and to drive internal projects
Excellent French, Excellent English level required
What’s in it for you?
This is an outstanding position for candidates that are really looking for a role with autonomy, accountability and responsibility, you are going to be critical in the success of our delivery through your phenomenal influencing and negotiation skills at a senior level, brought to Mindray, you get a ‘seat at the table’ and play a truly instrumental role, for this you will be well rewarded with a strong work / life balance, competitive salary, excellent benefits, a highly inclusive and diverse environment and opportunities for future career development in many areas.
Mindray Europe, as part of the global Mindray business, offers a wide selection of bespoke benefits dependent on your location, along with a competitive compensation package and a commitment to a long-term working relationship. With industry leading training and development available to you, you are sure to have a highly rewarding and mutually beneficial, career with Mindray, in a culture that values honesty and fun!
Our goal is to continuously improve and sustain an inclusive culture in which diversity provides deeper customer insights and creates a competitive advantage in the markets we serve. By attracting, developing, and engaging the best team of diverse, empowered associates, we help build success for ourselves and our customers.

title: Qualitative Research Director
summary:
Discussing briefs with clients, to fully grasp their business issue.
We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new…
date: Il y a plus de 30 jours
desc:
We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in.
To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply...
Job Details
Qualitative Research Director
Kantar, Health Division
Paris, France
Looking for a new exciting opportunity? You are a qualitative senior researcher and are looking for a challenge, a position in which you will need to be creative and exercise all your problem solver skills? The Health Division of France is looking for a new Qualitative Research Director to strengthen their international qualitative research expertise. In this role, you will handle international qualitative projects, from proposal writing to delivery of results, including client management, and also support the development internally and with clients, of new qualitative approaches.
Qualitative market research in healthcare is based mainly on interviewing healthcare practitioners, and / or patients and carers to understand what drives their behaviour when it comes to prescription and consumption of health services and products. If you are passionate about market research in healthcare, Kantar is the place to be because of the multiple expertise we have developed, including Real World Evidence and Real World Databases, epidemiology, and also because our qualitative team is undergoing an ambitious transformation that you can be part of; moving from market research to a more consulting approach.
Within Kantar's Quali expertise, in an international environment, you will work for a portfolio of large account clients in the healthcare sector. You will join a very diverse and resolutely international team, and you will also be able to leverage on the strength of the Kantar network present in more than 80 countries worldwide. A dedicated qualitative consultant, you will however work in close collaboration with quantitative teams every day, because our qualitative and quantitative are integrated.
YOUR MISSIONS
As a Qual Research Director, you are fully autonomous:
Discussing briefs with clients, to fully grasp their business issue
Designing and pricing a proposal
Conducting the research in line with compliance and pharmacovigilance regulations
Analysing findings and writing an excellent story with these
Presenting to the client and following up on any queries
Contributing to the development of new qualitative approaches we have in store and support their commercial development as well
THE CANDIDATE
To be successful in the role
You have an experience of at least 8/10 years in international qualitative research studies
You have a genuine interest in the healthcare sector. Previous experience in healthcare would be a plus but is not necessarily required
You have a strong desire to ‘dust off’ your qualitative methods and think in a more holistic / consulting mode
You love to bring together large amounts of different types of data & information to tell a story: analysing and synthesizing is something you enjoy, and something you do with ease because you know how to sort elements essential to a story vs. details
You are creative and find new ways of supporting our clients
You are willing to work in strong collaboration with our EU colleagues, as one single team
You are fluent in English. You will be speaking English all day
You are interested in developing new qualitative approaches and supporting the development of our new strategy for our clients
You are flexible and are a problem solver: you will not hesitate to come out of your comfort zone or network to tackle an issue. You can adapt really easily to different situations.
JOIN US
Join Kantar and be part of a leading consulting international organization.
You will be surrounded by passionate colleagues in an open and engaging environment. You will be given room to work a large variety of topics and grow, and continuously develop yourself together with some of the best within their expertise.
If interested, do not hesitate and apply!
We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in.
At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive, and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.
Location
Paris, av Pierre MasseFrance
Kantar Rewards Statement
At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.
Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow.

CAST is the market leader in Software Intelligence. Its unique technology thoroughly examines the structure of complex software systems, with MRI-like precision. It delivers accurate, actionable, and automated views of software architecture, critical flaws, quality grades, sizing metrics, open source usage, and cloud readiness levels. title: STAGE - GI – Aide à la décision pour l'optimisation des flux...
summary: Développement d’un tableau de bord pour la gestion prévisionnelle des validations nécessaires par ligne de produit (gestion de flux, Business intelligence),.
date: Il y a plus de 30 jours
desc:
Position description
Posting title
STAGE - GI – Aide à la décision pour l'optimisation des flux de production - H/F M/F
Regular/Temporary
Temporary
Job description
L’usine de fabrication de plaquettes 300mm de Crolles est une des plus modernes du monde : ordonnancement, transport et traitement des produits sur les machines, toutes ces tâches sont aujourd’hui automatisées et nos personnels de production vivent désormais au quotidien l’industrie du futur. Du fait de la technicité des processus de fabrication et des exigences en termes de service client, certains processus de pilotage restent cependant du domaine de l’humain car ils doivent intégrer des informations à la fois très complexes et extrêmement variables.
Au sein du département « Engineering Methods & Solutions » vous êtes chargé(e) d’adapter l’approche algorithmique existante pour traduire en actions concrètes et locales (ateliers, machines de production) les décisions prises par le système global de planification et de régulation de la production. Pour ce faire, après une période d’immersion en production, vous devrez conduire les activités suivantes :
Prise en main de l’outil FlexQual et identification des différentes sources de données et d’information du périmètre (planification et contrôle de production, gestion des validations équipement, ordonnancement, etc.)
Formalisation des processus décisionnels mis en jeu et définition du processus cible pour l’amélioration du temps de cycle produit et de la productivité équipement (VSM, Business Process Modelling),
Développement d’un tableau de bord pour la gestion prévisionnelle des validations nécessaires par ligne de produit (gestion de flux, Business intelligence),
Développement d’un outil d’aide à la décision (Recherche Opérationnelle) pour l’amélioration de la flexibilité et de la robustesse de la ligne de production en termes de flux produits.
En collaboration avec les responsables des départements « process » et « production » de l’usine, vous proposerez une approche incrémentale, facilement adaptable aux différents types et volumétries de demandes.
De formation Génie Industriel, vous aimeriez intégrer une composante recherche (Master Recherche éventuellement) et avez des compétences en informatique. Vous êtes motivé(e) par une première expérience dans une industrie complexe et en perpétuelle évolution ? Alors n’hésitez pas, faites-nous parvenir CV et lettre de motivation et rejoignez aujourd’hui l’industrie du futur !
Profile
Obligatoires : Gestion de Flux, Supply Chain, Recherche Opérationnelle
Souhaitées / négociables : Bases de données SQL, BI
Vous êtes autonome, à l’aise en équipe et attiré(e) par l’industrie de pointe et les technologies de la décision. Vos qualités relationnelles vos capacités d’analyse et de synthèse seront des atouts indispensables pour ce poste et une éventuelle évolution interne vers les nombreux métiers de la production.
Position localisation
Job location
Europe, France, Crolles
Candidate criteria
Education level required
5 - Master degree
Experience level required
Less than 2 years
Languages
French (3- Advanced)
English (3- Advanced)
Requester
Desired start date
03/02/2020

véritable expert(e) de votre métier, vous avez déjà éprouvé vos compétences à travers des expériences opérationnelles réussies en transport (5 à 10 ans). Pragmatique et orienté(e) performance, vous possédez d'excellentes qualités analytiques et organisationnelles. title: Apprenticeship: Strategy analyst (F/M)
summary: In charge of the monthly Market intelligence publication of BU Hydrogen, you will select relevant news, announcements, studies and reports valuable for the team…
date: Il y a plus de 30 jours
desc:
Renewable hydrogen (produced from water electrolysis) is central to ENGIE’s strategy driven by decarbonization, decentralization and digitalization. Our ambition is to become a major player in renewable hydrogen being at the forefront of global transformations in the industry, mobility and tertiary sectors. We want to scale up the Hydrogen economy.
ENGIE is uniquely placed to deliver on these objectives. Our worldwide presence, strong industrial capabilities and local anchorage as well as a deep know-how in both gas and power management, including midstream infrastructure operations, such as storage, allow us develop integrated solutions for our customers all across the value chain (from renewable hydrogen production by water electrolysis of renewable energies, storage, transportation, distribution and services to end users).

Our ambition is to become a renewable hydrogen major present worldwide providing its customers with integrated zero-carbon solutions based on renewable H2.
We develop solutions for industrials (using hydrogen in their processes) and territories looking for carbon free solutions (H2 as a fuel for mobility, flexibility solutions for the local energy system…).
-
Our passion stems from the desire to preserve our planet for next generations, knowing that Hydrogen should contribute for 20% of the CO2 emissions required to achieve the 2°C goal. Our ambition is to make it happen now at industrial scale, through concrete affordable renewable based hydrogen solutions.
H2 BU is :
a young and lean business unit activating very large external & internal networks of people and competencies on many geographies around the world.
Multi-localized with people based closed to the fields of actions. We have already developed a portfolio of projects in various countries such as Chile, Australia, Netherlands, France.
organized on roles basis, and the delivery of the strategic roadmap is organized in a project mode with ST objectives.
It allows each partner to express his leadership, handle new responsibilities and work on very different type of subjects, where the contribution of everyone is key to come up with solutions that do not exist today. .
H2 BU offers you a unique playground to express your talents, bring your curiosity, creativity and courage. and grow yourself by experiencing new and very diverse areas. Our DNA is definitely an agile culture:
we are customer oriented, by co-building tailor-made solutions adapted to their problems
we are daring: we investigate new topics by imagining innovative, sustainable and profitable solutions
we promote innovation by developing collaborative working methods based on "test and learn"
We truly care about the environment and improving the quality of people's lives
We promote the collective support , by strengthening the culture of feedback
Do you want to live a unique adventure, working in a fast-growing BU and market? Building innovative, sustainable and friendly solutions, within a multicultural team that allow you to explore new ways of working?
If you share our DNA and are aligned with our purpose “make the zero carbon transition” a reality, then join our journey to a better world, and apply for our new internship : You will be our Apprentice: Strategy analyst
You will support 3 main roles within the BU :
1. H2 Market intelligence

Purpose : support to all BU members.

Accountabilities :

In charge of the monthly Market intelligence publication of BU Hydrogen, you will select relevant news, announcements, studies and reports valuable for the team’s knowledge of H2 markets (strategic moves, business announcements, technologies, economics, …)

In complement to that work, you will issue specific memos on selected topics that need additional insight, context, and strategic take-aways for the BU ;

2. H2 players monitoring
Purpose : support commercial activities, regulatory team, Senior Management.

Accountabilities :

Upon request from internal customers, research on H2 market stakeholders (e.g. player cards, briefing notes …)

3. Other support to strategic analyses
Support strategic analyses and recommendations : studies, market data, contribution to internal strategic documents, …

You want to share and/or develop ?
Creative thinking: be able to suggest innovative solutions to everyday problems Self-starter state of mind
The ability to rapidly assess, analyze, and resolve problems with little initial information or direction and with varying degrees of ambiguity
Team players partners culture
Demonstrate empathy and respect for people
Develop authentic relationships, through generous listening and straight talk
Qualifications
oYou prepare a degree in business, strategy, finance, energy economics, or a related degree ;
oYou are a fast learner and able to upskill yourself quickly on new topics ;
oCreative and bold ;
oPassionate about strategy & entrepreneurship ;
oYou are a Fluent English speaker, French and/or Spanish would be a plus ;


Job

date: il y a 3 jours
desc:
Et si votre alternance se poursuivait chez HOWDENS CUISINES ?

Rejoignez-nous en tant que Assistant Data Analyst en alternance, au siège social Howdens Cuisines, basé sur Vendin-le-Vieil (62).

VOTRE MISSION ?

Au sein de l’équipe Digitale et rattaché au Responsable Digital, vous aurez pour mission principale de contribuer aux études et analyses pour le service Offre.
Vos missions seront les suivantes :
Réaliser des études Marketing
Développer et industrialiser les reportings du service
Mettre en place de segmentations client pour la communication ciblée
Gérer l'outil de gestion de campagne
Contribuer à l’évolution des outils

PROFIL :

Vous êtes en Licence Professionnelle marketing, Métiers du décisionnel et de la statistique ou Systèmes d'Information et Analyse Décisionnelle
Vous maitrisez le pack Office. Des notions de SAP Business Object BI seraient un plus
Vous êtes volontaire, force de propositions, vous faîtes preuve d’une capacité d’analyse, de synthèse, vous êtes rigoureux et autonome ? Vous aimez le goût du challenge ?
Rejoignez-nous ! Et vous vivrez une expérience professionnelle riche au sein d’une structure en phase d’expansion importante.


Mais qui est HOWDENS CUISINES ? La filiale française du groupe Howden Joinery, grand fournisseur Anglais de cuisines côté à la bourse de Londres. En 2018, avec 9 700 salariés, le groupe Howden Joinery enregistre un chiffre d’affaires de plus de 1,5 milliard d’euros.

Nous nous démarquons grâce à un modèle économique résolument différent de celui de nos concurrents, et proposons une offre complète de cuisines en France et en Belgique.
Poste à pourvoir en septembre 2020 en CDD d’un an, en alternance

title: Alternance - Assistant Data Analyst SAS H/F
summary: Au sein de la Direction du développement Marketing des engagements sociaux et sociétaux, vous intégrerez le Département Production et données, en charge de la…
date: il y a 4 jours
desc:
Contrat
ALTERNANCE
Finalité du poste
Au sein de la Direction du développement Marketing des engagements sociaux et sociétaux, vous intégrerez le Département Production et données, en charge de la mise en œuvre des campagnes multicanales du groupe Malakoff Humanis.
Vous travaillerez à garantir la qualité et à optimiser l’utilisation des données clients pour une meilleure efficacité des campagnes du Plan d’actions commerciales (PAC) et hors PAC, tous marchés (B2B et B2C) et tous canaux (digital, voix, print). Vous contribuerez aux projets de transformation des systèmes d’information commerciaux et des datamarts visant à une meilleure utilisation et à une meilleure protection de nos données clients.
Vos missions
Gestion des études récurrentes hebdomadaires et mensuelles via l’outil SAS.

Participation à la définition des besoins métiers, à la rédaction des processus, au suivi de la mise en œuvre des évolutions, notamment dans le cadre de l’intégration des campagnes BtoB dans Adobe Campaign.

Participation à l’optimisation de datamarts SAS et à l’intégration des données liées à la mise en place d’un nouveau Référentiel Client Unique Groupe.

Contribution aux travaux d’amélioration des processus et des SI, dans le cadre de la règlementation GDPR.

Préparation des campagnes, en utilisant une approche statistique visant à mieux cibler les individus à prospecter lors des campagnes marketing (scoring, analyse factorielle…).

Enrichissement des bases de données B2B et B2C en veillant à l’amélioration de la qualité de ces dernières pour garantir les meilleurs ciblages / études possibles.

Maintenance et évolution d’un suivi d’indicateurs B2B et mise en place d’un suivi d’indicateurs B2C via Power BI et mise à disposition du dashboard.
Profil recherché
Titulaire d’un Bac +3, vous souhaitez préparer un Master 1 / 2 Statistiques, vous êtes à l’aise avec l’outil informatique SAS et Microsoft Office (Excel, Power BI), des connaissances en SQL ainsi qu’une première expérience en marketing seraient appréciées.
Vous faites preuve de rigueur et d’organisation, vous êtes reconnu(e) pour votre esprit d’analyse et de synthèse ainsi que pour votre aisance relationnelle et votre facilité d’adaptation.
